title: Unionizing
text:
NewsGuild: Organize with us
Communication Workers of America: How to organize
SAG-AFTRA steps to join
The Writers Guild of America East “contact an organizer” form
SPJ Florida webinar: So your newsroom wants to unionize. Now what?
Labor Notes is a good place to keep up with labor news in general, but it’s also a network of members, union leaders and labor activists who can be helpful during your organization process
Nieman Journalism Lab: How we unionized the digital team at The Seattle Times (and how you can do it at your company too)
AFL-CIO “form a union” page
UE’s five basic steps to organizing a union


Note about AFL-CIO and UE: while we can’t organize under either of these names, the organizations have long and strong histories of successfully unionizing that we can learn from.

title: Layoffs
text:

Laid off to launch: a toolkit for journalists from News Revenue Hub
Freelance Investigative Reporters and Editors (FIRE)
The Freelance Solidarity Project
Notes from a Hired Pen - blog (and $10 e-book) by a freelancer of almost two decades on what worked and what didn’t in freelancing
Resources for journalists looking to start anew
Unemployment filing links and instructions for every state
Surviving Journalism Layoffs: Essential Tips for Recovery, by Janelle O’Dea
